meanings.sent1: Her travails in climbing the steep hill left her exhausted.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's daily travails included tilling the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all the groceries up the stairs was quite the travails for the young boy.
meanings.sent4: The journey through the dense forest was a series of challenging travails.
meanings.sent5: The weightlifter's travails to lift the heavy barbell were evident in his strained muscles.

meanings.definition: To engage in painful or laborious work
meanings.sent1: She travails tirelessly to provide for her family.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers travails under the scorching sun to build the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: The chef travails in the kitchen to create culinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent4: The artist travails for hours on end to perfect each brushstroke.
meanings.sent5: He travails through the night to finish his assignment before the deadline.

meanings.definition: A painful or laborious task or effort
meanings.sent1: Completing the marathon was a true travails for the inexperienced runner.
meanings.sent2: The students faced the travails of studying for their final exams.
meanings.sent3: The family's travails to set up the tent in the dark forest led to laughter and mishaps.
meanings.sent4: Overcoming the travails of learning a new language requires dedication and practice.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's travails in the harsh desert tested his survival skills.
